function_reachability: Is it impossible for function 'malloc' to reach function 'main'?
Is there a call path from function 'main' to function 'printf'?
Is there a call path from function 'main' to function 'malloc'?
Is it impossible for function 'printf' to reach function 'main'?
loop_reachability: Is it possible that the loop with condition 'i < ROWS' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition 'i < ROWS' always executed?
Is it possible that the loop with condition 'j < COLUMNS' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition 'j < COLUMNS' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i < ROWS' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'j < COLUMNS' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Does the value assigned to 'argc' affect subsequent computations?
Is variable 'argv' used after its definition?
liveness: Does variable 'argc' remain in use at the end of function 'main'?
Does variable 'i' remain in use at the end of function 'main'?
dead_code: Is the statement 'n->down->sum_to_goal = n->down->value + n->sum_to_goal;' unreachable?
Can the program actually reach the statement: “int sum = 0;”?
